poem:
### Echoes of Dissonance

In Southport's narrow lanes,  
the shadows of the past chorus—  
young voices silenced,  
a dirge echoes in riot's rhythm.  
Notting Hill's ghostly whispers  
stir once more  
in the cobblestones,  
as history dances  
the same old elegy,  
unleashing the storm  
of remembered grief.  
   
Futures we feared  
still query our hearts.
